page.title: 14WROXALL: THE ESTATE (1)
page.content:
{ }In 1945 the Forestry Commission took over the{Wroxall Estate,}and it was planted with hard and soft woods. Before then it was administered by the Park Royal Dog Company. Lady Millard, the owner,comes from the{Dugdale family,who lived at Wroxall Abbey until 1935 when it became a school. The Estate consists of{1250 acres.} Most of the land is Grade 2,pre-heavy clay.
The biggest change in farming in the area in recent years has been from{ {milk production}to{arable.}Farmers on the estate grow a 'break crop' called {horse rape,}because they cannot grow corn all the year;it is used to make lipstick and margarine. Rents used to be 18p an acre or 17/6;they are now Â£30-Â£40,so farmers cannot afford not to grow a crop.
